strIntroduction: Enjoy an exciting day out as you set off for Forest Research Institute Malaysia or FRIM, and discover the wonders of the tropical rainforest. Founded by the British colonial forest scientist in 1929, FRIM offers a back-to-nature experience whilst enjoying the flora and fauna in a natural ecosystem. Within this fascinating institute, there are jungle trails, canopy walkway, waterfalls, a library and a museum, housing a small collection of the nation's rich forest heritage.

strIntroduction: Libaran Island lies on the north-eastern coast of Sabah, about 40 minutes boat ride from Sandakan and five minutes away from the main islands of Sabah’s Turtle Island Park. Libaran Island support about 450 inhabitants whose main livelihood being fishing and boat making. Turtles are known to come ashore and lay their eggs on the island.

strIntroduction: A jewel-like tiny island in the Sulu Sea, a 1.5 hour boat rides north of Sandakan; Lankayan has been declared part of an immense Marine Protected Area to adopt the eco-tourism concept.
